intro: Hirtella bicornis, commonly known as the two-horned hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and its leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Hirtella bicornis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
